Submodules¶

pyevolcomp.Algorithm module¶

class pyevolcomp.Algorithm.Algorithm(name: str = 'some algorithm', popSize: int = 100)¶

Bases: ABC

Population of the Genetic algorithm Note: for methods that use only one solution at a time, use a population of length 1 to store it.

best_solution()¶

Gives the best solution found by the algorithm and its fitness

extra_report(show_plots: bool)¶

Specific information to display relevant to this algorithm

extra_step_info()¶

Specific information to display relevant to this algorithm

initialize(objfunc: ObjectiveFunc)¶

Generates a random population of individuals

abstract perturb(parent_list: List[Indiv], progress: float, objfunc: ObjectiveFunc, history: List[float]) → List[Indiv]¶

Applies operators to the population in some way Returns the offspring generated.

select_individuals(population: List[Indiv], offspring: List[Indiv], progress: float = 0, history: List[float] | None = None) → List[Indiv]¶

Selects the individuals that will pass to the next generation. Returns the offspring if not implemented.

select_parents(population: List[Indiv], progress: float = 0, history: List[float] | None = None) → List[Indiv]¶

Selects the individuals that will be perturbed in this generation Returns the whole population if not implemented.

update_params(progress: float)¶

Updates the parameters and the operators

pyevolcomp.Decoder module¶

class pyevolcomp.Decoder.Decoder¶

Bases: ABC

Base class for transforming between phenotype and genotype

abstract decode(genotype)¶

Decodes the contents of an individual to a viable solution to our problem

abstract encode(phenotype)¶

Encodes a viable solution to our problem to the encoding used in each individual of the algorithm

pyevolcomp.Individual module¶

class pyevolcomp.Individual.Indiv(objfunc: ObjectiveFunc, vector: np.ndarray, speed: np.ndarray = None, operator: Operator = None)¶

Bases: object

Individual that holds a tentative solution with its fitness.

apply_speed() → Indiv¶

Apply the speed to obtain an individual with a new position.

property fitness: float¶

Obtain the fitness of the individual, optimized to be calculated only once per individual.

property genotype: np.ndarray¶

Gets the value of the vector.

reproduce(population: List[Indiv]) → Indiv¶

Apply the operator to obtain a new individual.

store_best(past_indiv: Indiv)¶

Stores the vector that yeided the best fitness between the one the indiviudal has and another input vector

pyevolcomp.ObjectiveFunc module¶

class pyevolcomp.ObjectiveFunc.ObjectiveFunc(input_size: int, opt: str, name: str = 'some function', decoder: BaseDecoder = None)¶

Bases: ABC

Abstract Fitness function class.

For each problem a new class will inherit from this one and implement the fitness function, random solution generation, mutation function and crossing of solutions.

fitness(indiv: Indiv, adjusted: bool = True) → float¶

Returns the value of the objective function given a vector changing the sign so that the optimization problem is solved by maximizing the fitness function.

abstract objective(vector: ndarray) → float¶

Implementation of the objective function.

penalize(indiv: Indiv) → float¶

Gives a penalization to the fitness value of an individual if it violates any constraints propotional to how far it is to a viable solution.

If not implemented always returns 0.

abstract random_solution() → ndarray¶

Returns a random vector that represents one viable solution to our optimization problem.

abstract repair_solution(vector: ndarray) → ndarray¶

Transforms an invalid vector into one that satisfies the restrictions of the problem.

repair_speed(speed)¶

Transforms an invalid vector into one that satisfies the restrictions of the problem.

set_decoder(decoder: BaseDecoder)¶

Sets the decoder

pyevolcomp.Operator module¶

class pyevolcomp.Operator.Operator(method: str, params: ParamScheduler | dict, name=None)¶

Bases: ABC

Abstract Operator class

abstract evolve(solution, population, objfunc)¶

Evolves a solution with a different strategy depending on the type of substrate

step(progress)¶

Updates the parameters of the method using a paramater scheduler if it exists

pyevolcomp.ParamScheduler module¶

class pyevolcomp.ParamScheduler.ParamScheduler(strategy: str, param_schedule: dict)¶

Bases: object

This class is responsible of varying the parameters of an algorithm over time.

get_params() → dict¶

Returns a dictionary containing the current parameters

reset()¶

Sets all the parameters to their initial values

step(progress: float)¶

Changes the values of the parameters interpolating between the initial and final values.

pyevolcomp.ParentSelection module¶

class pyevolcomp.ParentSelection.ParentSelection(name: str, params: ParamScheduler | dict | None = None)¶

Bases: object

Operator class that has continuous mutation and cross methods

select(population: List[Indiv]) → List[Indiv]¶

Selects a subsection of the population along with the indices of each individual in the original population

step(progress: float)¶

Updates the parameters of the method using a paramater scheduler if it exists

pyevolcomp.ParentSelection.prob_tournament(population, tourn_size, prob)¶

Selects the parents for the next generation by tournament

pyevolcomp.ParentSelection.select_best(population, amount)¶

Selects the best parent of the population as parents

pyevolcomp.Search module¶

class pyevolcomp.Search.Search(search_strategy: Algorithm, params: ParamScheduler | dict)¶

Bases: ABC

General framework for metaheuristic algorithms

best_solution()¶

Returns the best solution so far in the population.

abstract display_report(objfunc, show_plots=True)¶

Shows a summary of the execution of the algorithm

get_progress(gen, time_start, objfunc)¶

Given the state of the algorithm, returns a number between 0 and 1 indicating how close to the end of the algorithm we are, 0 when starting and 1 when finished.

initialize(objfunc)¶

Generates a random population of individuals

optimize(objfunc)¶

Execute the algorithm to get the best solution possible along with it’s evaluation

restart()¶

Resets the internal values of the algorithm and the number of evaluations of the fitness function.

save_solution(file_name='solution.csv')¶

Save the result of an execution to a csv file in disk.

abstract step(objfunc, time_start=0, verbose=False) → Tuple[Indiv, float]¶

Performs a step in the algorithm

abstract step_info(objfunc, start_time)¶

Displays information about the current state of the algotithm

stopping_condition(gen, real_time_start, objfunc)¶

Given the state of the algorithm, returns wether we have finished or not.

update(gen, time_start, objfunc)¶

Given the state of the algorithm, returns a number between 0 and 1 indicating how close to the end of the algorithm we are, 0 when starting and 1 when finished.

pyevolcomp.Search.parse_stopping_cond(condition_str)¶

This function parses an expression of the form “neval or cpu_time” into a tree structure so that it can be futher processed.

pyevolcomp.Search.process_condition(cond_parsed, neval, ngen, real_time, target)¶

This function recieves as an input an expression for the stopping condition and the truth variable of the possible stopping conditions and returns wether to stop or not.

pyevolcomp.SurvivorSelection module¶

class pyevolcomp.SurvivorSelection.SurvivorSelection(name: str, params: ParamScheduler | dict | None = None)¶

Bases: object

Operator class that has continuous mutation and cross methods

select(popul: List[Indiv], offspring: List[Indiv]) → List[Indiv]¶

Takes a population with its offspring and returns the individuals that survive to produce the next generation.

step(progress: float)¶

Updates the parameters of the method using a paramater scheduler if it exists

pyevolcomp.SurvivorSelection.cond_elitism(popul, offspring, amount)¶
pyevolcomp.SurvivorSelection.elitism(popul, offspring, amount)¶
